scenario_text.value: You’ve all done something truly amazing.

Professor? What’s gotten into you all of a
sudden?

Just look at how many lives you saved. Take a
moment to be proud. You’ve earned it.

It doesn’t feel like we’ve done anything to
be proud of. We were just desperate.
Desperate not to lose anyone.

It’s that mindset that’s most important. It’s
something we adults can forget sometimes.

(The professor’s praise feels overblown.
We didn’t do anything that incredible...)

(Besides, the professor’s saved us more times
than I can count. He deserves the praise.)

(At any rate, this is just the beginning.
We’re trying to save the world here.)
(What should I say to the professor?)
You exaggerate.
No time to celebrate.
You’ve done as much.

You’re exaggerating. We’ve been running
around frantically this whole time.

Ha ha, if you insist. Then we’ll leave it at
that.

It’s just, you children have ignited a fire
of justice within me long since extinguished.

I appreciate the compliment, but we can’t
celebrate just yet.

We’re trying to rescue the two worlds. That
means we’ll be saving a lot more people.

Yes, right you are. Still, to think you’d
make such a declaration so unabashedly...

What a strong heart you possess. No wonder
you’ve stoked such a fire in me.
But Professor, you saved us so many times.

However much I may have helped you, you’ve
helped me more.

Huh, is that right? Um... When exactly did we
do that?

Ho ho, I don’t mean saving my life. The days
spent here, the time we shared was precious.

The youthful passion and resolve of you all.
I want to do all I can too, old as I am.

I never would have accomplished this feat on
my own. You have my sincere gratitude.

I feel like I should make it up to you
somehow.

Don’t worry about it, Professor. After all,
you’re one of us.

You think so? You really feel like I’m one of
you?
Absolutely.

To think at this age, you’d accept me as one
of your own...
Haha, isn’t life strange?

Life is so strange. I wish all of you could
feel what I feel.
